benchmark_details.name: SurgiSR4K (Surgical Super Resolution 4K)
benchmark_details.overview: SurgiSR4K is the first publicly available surgical imaging and video dataset captured at a native 4K resolution, representing realistic conditions of robotic-assisted minimally invasive procedures. It comprises diverse visual scenarios and is designed to support tasks including super resolution (SR), surgical instrument detection, 3D tissue reconstruction, and more.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of SurgiSR4K is to provide a high-resolution dataset for surgical imaging research, enabling the development of intelligent imaging technologies aimed at enhancing performance, safety, and usability in image-guided robotic surgeries.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset's collection involved open surgical techniques which may limit the scope of traditional laparoscopic methods.

data.source: Captured during in vivo surgeries on porcine models under realistic surgical conditions using a Da Vinci Xi surgical robot system.
data.format: PNG for images, AVI for videos
data.annotation: Clinical validation was performed by experienced medical professionals to ensure relevance and clarity.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on pixel alignment and perceptual quality assessment against ground truth data.
methodology.interpretation: Higher PSNR and MSSIM values indicate better performance and fidelity of generated images compared to real images.
methodology.validation: Dataset validation involved reviews by clinical experts to ensure accuracy and usability.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data was collected from animal models under strict ethical guidelines and approval from IACUC.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Released under the Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International license.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: N/A - No human subjects were involved.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: All procedures were conducted in accordance with the institutionâ€™s ethical standards.
